column4: All I know is I've had trouble with using the "upgrade" button in Update Manager before, but reformating and freshly installing fixed the issue.
I've heard other people say that too. But I'm no expert. Sadly.
ohei. Join the broken sound club :D
I'm pretty sure my issue is a bug. And I posted on the forums and no one has replied. Huzzah. Should I report it? >_>
thats the command to report an audio bug and automatically include a whole bunch of audio debugging info to make it easier for developers to fix your bug

thankfully there is a team of people working to ask the right questions on the bug reports :) that command's auto-magic stuff keeps them from having to ask for the same set of log files and hardware info from everyone though so you get fewer questions in your email to answer about the bug
yeah...cuz if you're using pulse, everything goes through it. your user doesnt need to be in the audio group (and by default isnt)
so its probably a driver bug
adding things to alsa-base.conf usually takes a reboot to go into effect, btw
